channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing bin - again!!, 21st August
item.description:
This bin is continuously overflowing. The majority of items are now flying into the river. Can’t remember when this bin was collected last. There used to be two bins and one was taken away. Need a rethink as to a better solution or remove the bin all together as I live directly opposite and is an eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mudlarks Boulevard, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 21st August
item.description:
This is the 3rd time this week it has been cleaned it’s a constant problem with the flats above as soon as it’s cleared more get put there the crows are ripping them apart for the food they leaving inside and it stinks I think monitoring needs to be done on this as it’s regular

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Crampton Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike Lane Street Paint Barely Visible, 21st August
item.description:
The painted signs on the cycle lanes are now barely visible. Especially the “SLOW” one. Cyclists are zooming past people and other cyclists without considering to slow down, partially because that street signage is gone.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MIssing bin, 21st August
item.description:
Our communal bin has been taken away and we have nowhere to put our rubbish. Bags are being left on the floor where there are still rats.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tavistock Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Nw1 9rq, 21st August
item.description:
The new lamps have not been fitted by the council. The area has temporary lighting affixed on barriers installed by bam. Said barriers have not been removed yet as that is what carries the only lights on that street. Please finish the pavement lights, as the road has a temporary state of disrepair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Augustine's Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking pavement without diversions or permit, 21st August
item.description:
No permit or diversions and no access for people with wheelchairs. They then proceed to verbally harass you if you complain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Randolph Avenue, Maida Vale, London

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Cupboard overflowing with garbage, 21st August
item.description:
Cupboard overflowing with piled high rubbish at 38 Hoxton Square. No signs of it being collected. It is swarming with flies and I have seen an increase of mice in the area. Has been an issue for a few weeks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hoxton Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: WEEDS all around DOBSON WALK, 21st August
item.description:
Weeds appearing up and down Dobson Walk - both sides of the road. HODGKIN and BARRETT court particularly affected. Might damage pavement over winter, as cold sets in? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dobson Walk, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scraps, 21st August
item.description:
There is no one week that goes by without people dumping waste at the end of my street, often placed right at the door of my bicycle locker. This is totally disgraceful, occupies a pedestrian space, it looks horrendous, it's antigenic, fetid, utterly disgusting. moreover, the food waste Southwark council place there throws a stinking odour, I wish you place that container somewhere else, the area is terribly fetid specially in hot days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85-107, Rodney Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
